BITR.name: Mod Performance
BITR.description: Per our discussion today. Jitesh/Will/Diane/Mary/Mark – We need to look at building some Trial Mod Default Rate and Mod Re-Default Rate reporting based on DTIs bands Analysts at Fitch have found that loans modified after 2014 have higher re-default rates. The data was published was part of the company’s “Historical Modification Data Review” which analyzed Fannie Mae’s dataset for modified single-family mortgages. The dataset contained 700,000 loans and a $135 billion balance. Of these, 448,000 loans were still active with an outstanding balance of $75 billion. Based on the data being collected since 2009, there is a strong tie between new loan modification and higher re-default rates. Analysts found that loans modified after 2014 have higher re-default rates, with 2015 being the highest since 2010. The report cites weak credit attributes as a possible cause for the spike since the average FICO score was only 592. These loans re-defaulted quickly after modification. Seventy-five percent of them within the first two years alone. Traditionally, loan-to-value (LTV) ratios and credit scores are risk predictors, but the report stated that “loan modification terms play a significant role and there is direct correlation between the amount of the payment reduction and re-default rates. Borrowers who received multiple modifications have higher re-default rates.” The majority of the loans included in the report were modified per one of the following three programs: Home Affordable Modification Program (HAMP), Streamlined Modification Program (SMP), Standard Modification. Unlike HAMP and Standard Modification, which use step-up mortgages and require documented hardship, SMP doesn’t require the borrower to have a documented hardship and focuses on fixed-rate modifications. Although SMP loans comprised much of the outstanding balance in the dataset ($35 billion, or 47 percent of the overall balance), the highest re-default rate is found in Standard Modification loans. These borrowers typically don’t qualify for HAMP or have defaulted on HAMP before. Fannie Mae plans to replace Standard Modification in late 2017 with the Fannie Mae Flex Modification Program. HAMP loans had the lowest re-default rate out of all three programs. The analysts predicted that the trends identified in Fannie Mae’s historical dataset are predominant in loans not only owned by Fannie Mae, but other institutions as well. Read the original Fitch Report here.

BITR.name: ArcHome - Marketing Data - Creation 22nd Campaign
BITR.description: Business would like 22nd marketing file put together for a standard campaign (which models BITR 39273 for campaign 21). Please wait to pull this leads list together until Nov. 1 so that we begin new pay history month. The pulling of the leads list for our letter campaigns are being transitioned from Mark W's team to Jitesh's team. The only 2 changes which now become the new standard. (1) Remove NY from states (WEI is having problems with this licensing); Excluded states/territories are: NY, ID, UT, NV, HI, MO, Guam & Virgin Islands. (2) Remove the Acquisitions Date criteria exclusion scrub (Delinquent At Time of Boarding) as we will be doing letter campaign that requires more disclosures. •Please note - Loans still due for 11/1/17 are current loans until 12/1/17 and should not be excluded from the population. •Would like a loan level breakdown report to see rejects. Besides these standard exclusion headers: [property_state, do_not_solicit, do_not_call, pay_history, aacer_hit, principal_balance, maturity_date, is_bnk, is_reo, is_litigation, loans_already_referred, delinquent] are there other headers that can provide greater transparency on what is being excluded? For example, No Active Borrower Number, BK 7 discharge (which we now include if does not have Rep by Attorney status), Rep by Attorney). Are there any property types or occupancy types that are being excluded that we should track as rejects? Just trying to give a snapshot of why loans were excluded. ArcHome is requesting very detailed analysis of why loans are excluded. Can you add 12 month paystring (i.e. 000000000011) as column to reject report?

BITR.name: BK Dashboard changes
BITR.description: We need to add the BKCRAD task to the dashboard under the tasks. This is to monitor the system adjustments from Loss Mit for cramdowns. We need to have an exception for when the document has been uploaded and not reviewed from the BK_DocFwd_Client process. Meaning step 1 is completed but step 2 is not. The exception will close when the step is completed. Call the exception BK Doc Pending Execution We need to have an exception added that identifies loans are pending the POC filing and it has been 45 days since the filing date. The POC filed step can come from LPS in the BK_POC_Atty process step 8. I want to see loans that are missing the POC filed date from that step and it is 45 days since the BK filing. Call the exception POC Not Filed at 45 Days. I need the BK Summary report updated for the column that currently reads Bk Filing 60 to read BK Filing + 45 and change the logic to reflect a date that is 45 days added to the BK filing date. It is currently set to 60 days and we want to set it at 45 days.

BITR.name: Credit Rptg-FiServ UAT-July2017 Metro2 Data Needed
BITR.description: Please provide a spreadsheet containing all loans that reported credit with a file date of 8/5/2017. For these loans please provide the following fields - if the field is not in the credit file information we store in the data warehouse, I've indicated the screen in MSP where it can be found: Loan Number Loan Type First Name Last Name CBR Account Status Payment History String (24 months) CBR Comment Code Last Modified Date (as of 8/5/2017) [MAS1/PRP1] Date of Birth ECOA Code Deferred/2nd Mortgage Amount (as of 8/5/2017) [MAS1/SEC1] Suppression Reason Flag [MAS1/CBR1] Assumption Date (as of 8/5/2017) [MAS1/ASM1] Bankruptcy Chapter (as of 8/5/2017) ]BNK1] Foreclosure Sale Date (as of 8/5/2017) [FOR1]

BITR.name: MSP R02 File Received in REO date

BITR.name: Fiserv - REO Balancing MSP
BITR.description: Please pull a report for the population of the REO loans on 4/30/2017 from MSP. The following four items should be included. REO loan numbers Date R02 step completed Date R35 step completed Date R55 step completed This is being used to compare the accuracy of the Fiserv report to the Selene report for the REO loan population as part of the preparation for conversion.

BITR.name: FHLMC Project Exception Bucket for Cramdowns
BITR.description: We are required by FHLMC to notify them when one of their loans is a cramdown. We have created a process in LPS called BK_cramdownreview. The exception will be that I have a FHLMC loan that is identified as a cramdown in MSP with the step B75 with a completion date and I do not have steps completed in the BK_cramdownreview process. We only have 1 day to notify FHLMC of the cramdown. The exception will fall off when the 2nd step is completed in the process.

BITR.name: Remove mod type C from Workout Summary Report
BITR.description: the workout summary report is including modification type of "C" as a completed modification when the modification date is populated in MAS1/PRP1. Modification type C is system generated when an arm loan is converted to a fixed loan not a true loan modification and should be excluded from the modification line in the report. Loan number example on today's report is 10149789 with a liquidation date in the report of 1/2/2018

BITR.name: SS & DIL Dashboard
BITR.description: We would like to make the following changes to the report: Rather than having a status of Title Issue, can we have a Column that has Title Issue Y or N, and Consent State Y or N. Full Payoff Y or N. We are losing the overall status of the loan such as listed or under contract when there is a title issue or Full Payoff as the status. We would like the Full Payoffs broken out into their own section of the report, similar to the breakout of Short Payoffs. For Cash for Keys and Consents, can you move status to completed/inactive when they reach the same status as the Workout Summary Report (foreclosure sale is held and Trash Out Completed, ...) The loans are not getting moved off the report and it's hard to tell what's gone to sale and what hasn't. Add Loan Status 01 to the Report next to Workout Status. Breakout status of Under Contract - if closing date is current month, status = Under Contract Current. If closing date is future month, stats = Under Contract Future. Add Final Resolution Funds Sent Date for Cash for Keys. Loan is being duplicated on the report if it's being dual tracked for SS and DIL. There is a field on the report to indicate the dual tracking and we also have duplicate DIL status fields for dual track. We only want to list the SS if there is active SS and DIL on the same loan.

BITR.name: Changes to BK dashboard
BITR.description: Can we add the below processes to the Loss Mit Approved exception so that when the processes are opened and the first step is completed, they fall off of the exception. Right now, nothing is having them fall out of the exception bucket. BK_LM_Contact_Order BK_LM_Contact_Order_Atty BK_LM_Mediation_Order_Atty
